articles.description:
The Twitter API is a set of programmatic endpoints that can be used to understand or build a Twitter conversation.
This API allows you to search for and retrieve, interact with, or create a variety of resources, including:
Some twitter API endpoints
GET /2/tweets/:id/quote_tweets :
Returns Quote Tweets for a Tweet specified by the requested Tweet ID.
POST /2/users/:id/retweets: Causes the user ID identified in the path parameter to Retweet the target Tweet.
DELETE /2/users/:id/retweets/:source_tweet_id
Allows a user or authenticated user ID to remove the Retweet of a Tweet.
 GET /2/tweets/sample/stream
Streams about 1% of all Tweets in real-time.
POST /2/users/:id/following
Allows a user ID to follow another user.If the target user does not have public Tweets, this endpoint will send a fol‚Ä¶
articles.title: Python-tweepy: automating a follow back task using windows scheduler

articles.author: Jos√© Miguel √Ålvarez Va√±√≥
articles.description:
To cherry-pick a commit from another repository you have to first add the other repository as a remote (a remote is a repository whose branches you are tracking). You have to give the remote a name.
git remote add <name> https://github.com/example.git

Then, you have to fetch the branches of the remote.
git fetch <name>

Now that you are tracking the other repository and have fetched the changes you can list the commits of a specific branch and cherry-pick a commit.
git log otherRepo/<branch>
git cherry-pick <commit>

In case that you don't want to track the remote anymore you can remove it with:
git remote remove <name>

More info about working with remotes here.
Git - Cherry-pick
Git - Remote
Git - Working with Remotes
articles.title: How to cherry-pick a commit from another repository

Linux ‰πãÁà∂ÁöÑ PC ÊåÇ‰∫ÜÔºåÊÅêÂΩ±Âìç Linux 6.1 ÂèëÂ∏É

‰∏§Âπ¥ÂâçÊàë‰ª¨¬†Êä•ÈÅì¬†ËøáÔºåLinus Torvalds Êîí‰∫Ü‰∏ÄÂè∞Êñ∞ÁîµËÑëÔºå‰∏ÄÊôÉ‰∏§Âπ¥ÂçäËøáÂéª‰∫ÜÔºåÂ¶Ç‰ªäÔºåËøôÂè∞ÁîµËÑëÁöÑÂÜÖÂ≠òÊù°Âùè‰∫ÜÔºåÈ¢ëÁπÅÂá∫Áé∞Êú∫Âô®‰∏çÁ®≥ÂÆöÁîöËá≥ÁºñËØëÂô®ÊçüÂùèÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµ„ÄÇÂΩìÊó∂ÔºåTorvalds Êú¨Êù•ÊÉ≥‰π∞ ECC ÂÜÖÂ≠òÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÂèàÂ´åÂ§™Ë¥µÔºå‰∫éÊòØ‰π∞‰∫Ü 4 Êù°‰æøÂÆúÁöÑ 16GB DDR4-2666 ÁöÑÂÜÖÂ≠ò„ÄÇÁõÆÂâçÔºåTorvalds ‰ΩøÁî®‰ªñÂ§ñÂá∫Êê∫Â∏¶ÁöÑ MacBook Pro Â∑•‰ΩúÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÊãñÊÖ¢‰∫Ü‰ªñÁöÑÂ∑•‰ΩúËøõÂ∫¶„ÄÇ‰ªñËØ¥Ôºå‚ÄúÊàëÊ≠£Âú®ÊàëÁöÑÁ¨îËÆ∞Êú¨ÁîµËÑë‰∏äËøõË°åÂêàÂπ∂ÔºàÈùûÂ∏∏ÁºìÊÖ¢ÔºâÔºåÂêåÊó∂Âú®Á≠âÂæÖÊñ∞ÁöÑ ECC ÂÜÖÂ≠òÊù°ÁöÑÂà∞Êù•„ÄÇ‚Äù„ÄÇ


Ê∂àÊÅØÊù•Ê∫êÔºöThe Register



ËÄÅÁéãÁÇπËØÑÔºöË∞ÅËÉΩÊÉ≥Âà∞ÔºåÊï¥‰∏™ Linux ‰∏ñÁïåÁöÑËøõÊ≠•Áì∂È¢àÂ∞±Âç°Âú®Âá†Êù°ÂÜÖÂ≠ò‰∏ä„ÄÇü§£




ÈæôÊû∂ÊûÑÂ∑≤ÂàùÊ≠•ÊîØÊåÅÂºÄÊ∫êÈ∏øËíôÊìç‰ΩúÁ≥ªÁªü

ÈæôËäØ‰∏≠ÁßëÂÆ£Â∏ÉÔºåÂºÄÊ∫êÈ∏øËíôÔºàOpenHarmonyÔºâÊìç‰ΩúÁ≥ªÁªü‰∏éÈæôËäØ 2K0500 ÂºÄÂèëÊùøÂÆåÊàêÈÄÇÈÖçÈ™åËØÅÔºåÈæôÊû∂ÊûÑÔºàLoongArchÔºâÂπ≥Âè∞ÂØπ‰∫éÂºÄÊ∫êÈ∏øËíôÂ∑≤ÂΩ¢ÊàêÂàùÊ≠•ÊîØÊåÅ„ÄÇÈæôËäØ 2K0500 ÊòØÂü∫‰∫é 64 ‰Ωç LA264 Â§ÑÁêÜÂô®Ê†∏ËÆæËÆ°ÁöÑÈ´òÈõÜÊàêÂ∫¶Â§ÑÁêÜÂô®ËäØÁâáÔºåËØ•ËäØÁâá‰∏ªË¶ÅÈù¢ÂêëÂ∑•Êéß‰∫íËÅîÁΩëÂ∫îÁî®„ÄÅÊâìÂç∞ÁªàÁ´Ø„ÄÅBMC Á≠âÂ∫îÁî®Âú∫ÊôØ„ÄÇ

ÂºÄÊ∫êËΩØ‰ª∂ÂÆâÂÖ®ÁöÑÈóÆÈ¢òÂú®‰∫éÔºåÂ∞ΩÁÆ°‰ªª‰Ωï‰∫∫ÈÉΩÂèØ‰ª•Êü•ÁúãÊ∫ê‰ª£Á†ÅÔºå‰ΩÜËøôÂπ∂‰∏çÊÑèÂë≥ÁùÄ‰ªñ‰ª¨‰ºöËøô‰πàÂÅö„ÄÇÊúâ‰∏Ä‰∫õÂπøÊ≥õ‰ΩøÁî®ÁöÑÂºÄÊ∫êÈ°πÁõÆ‰ªÖÁî±Êï∞ÈáèÊúâÈôêÁöÑÂ∑•Á®ãÂ∏àÁª¥Êä§„ÄÇËøô‰∫õÂ∑•Á®ãÂ∏àÊó†Ê≥ïÂÆåÂÖ®Ëá™ÊÑøÂú∞Êèê‰æõÊó∂Èó¥ÂíåÁ≤æÂäõÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫‰ªñ‰ª¨‰πüÈúÄË¶ÅÊîØ‰ªò‰ªñ‰ª¨ÁöÑË¥¶Âçï„ÄÇ

Âç≥‰ΩøÂØπ‰∫éÊõ¥Â§çÊùÇÁöÑÂºÄÊ∫êÈ°πÁõÆÔºåËøô‰πüÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÈóÆÈ¢ò„ÄÇ‰∏æ‰∏™‰æãÂ≠êÔºåLinux ÂÜÖÊ†∏È°πÁõÆÁî± 3000 Â§ö‰∏áË°å‰ª£Á†ÅÁªÑÊàêÔºåÂåÖÂê´Êï∞Áôæ‰∏™ÈúÄË¶ÅËß£ÂÜ≥ÁöÑÁº∫Èô∑ÔºåÂπ∂ÊúâËøë 2000 ÂêçÊ¥ªË∑ÉÁöÑÂºÄÂèëËÄÖ„ÄÇÊØè‰∏™Ê¥ªË∑ÉÁöÑÂºÄÂèëËÄÖÈÉΩÂÜô‰∫ÜË∂ÖËøá 15000 Ë°åÁöÑ‰ª£Á†Å„ÄÇ

Ê†πÊçÆ Linux Âü∫Èáë‰ºöÊúÄËøëÁöÑ‰∏ÄÈ°πÁ†îÁ©∂Ôºå‰∏Ä‰∏™Â∫îÁî®Á®ãÂ∫èÂπ≥ÂùáÊúâ 5.1 ‰∏™ÈáçÂ§ßÊºèÊ¥û‰ªçÊú™Ëß£ÂÜ≥Ôºå41% ÁöÑ‰ºÅ‰∏öÂØπÂÖ∂ÂºÄÊ∫êËΩØ‰ª∂ÁöÑÂÆâÂÖ®ÊÄßÁº∫‰πè‰ø°ÂøÉ„ÄÇËÄåÊõ¥Á≥üÁ≥ïÁöÑÊòØÔºåÂè™Êúâ 49% ÁöÑ‰ºÅ‰∏öÊã•ÊúâÂºÄÊ∫êÂÆâÂÖ®Á≠ñÁï•„ÄÇ

Âç≥‰ΩøÂºÄÊ∫êËΩØ‰ª∂ÊúâÂÆâÂÖ®ÊºèÊ¥ûÔºåËøô‰πü‰∏çËÉΩ‰øùËØÅÂÆÉËÉΩË¢´‰øÆÂ§ç„ÄÇË∞ÉÊü•ÊòæÁ§∫ÔºåÁõÆÂâç‰øÆÂ§ç‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊºèÊ¥ûÂπ≥ÂùáÈúÄË¶Å 97.8 Â§©Ôºå‰Ωø‰ΩøÁî®ËØ•ËΩØ‰ª∂ÁöÑ‰ºÅ‰∏öÂú®Âá†‰∏™ÊúàÂÜÖÂÆπÊòìÂèóÂà∞ÊîªÂáª„ÄÇËøôÂ∞±ÊòØÂºÄÊ∫êËΩØ‰ª∂ÂÆâÂÖ®ÊúâÊó∂Ë¢´ÂøΩËßÜÁöÑÂú∞ÊñπÔºöÂ∞±ÂÉèÂ•Ω‰∫∫ÂèØ‰ª•ÂØªÊâæ‰ª£Á†Å‰∏≠ÁöÑÈîôËØØÂíåÊºèÊ¥ûÊù•‰øÆÂ§çÂÆÉ‰ª¨‰∏ÄÊ†∑ÔºåÂùè‰∫∫‰πüÂèØ‰ª•ÂØªÊâæÂêåÊ†∑ÁöÑÊºèÊ¥ûÊù•Âà©Áî®ÂÆÉ‰ª¨„ÄÇ

‰ªÖ‰ªÖ‰æùÈù†ÂøóÊÑøËÄÖÁ§æÂå∫Êù•ÂèëÁé∞ÊºèÊ¥û„ÄÅÊä•ÂëäÊºèÊ¥ûÂíå‰øÆÂ§çÊºèÊ¥ûÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Êº´ÈïøÁöÑËøáÁ®ã„ÄÇÂú®‰Ω†ÁªßÁª≠ÂèóÁõä‰∫éÂºÄÊ∫êÁöÑÂπøÊ≥õ‰ºòÂäøÁöÑÂêåÊó∂ÔºåËä±Èí±ËØ∑‰∫∫Ê£ÄÊü•‰Ω†ÁöÑÂºÄÊ∫êËß£ÂÜ≥ÊñπÊ°àÁöÑÂÆâÂÖ®ÊÄßÂèØ‰ª•Â∏ÆÂä©Âº•Ë°•Ëøô‰∏™ÈóÆÈ¢ò„ÄÇ

Â•ΩÊ∂àÊÅØÔºö‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂÖçË¥πÁöÑ Ubuntu Pro ËÆ°ÂàíÔºåÊØè‰∏™‰∫∫ÈÉΩÂèØ‰ª•Ëé∑Âæó 10 Âπ¥ÁöÑÂÆâÂÖ®Êõ¥Êñ∞„ÄÇ




Canonical ‰∏∫ Ubuntu Pro ÂºïÂÖ•‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂÖçË¥πËÆ°‰ª∑Â±ÇÔºåËØ•Â±ÇÈíàÂØπ‰∏™‰∫∫‰ΩøÁî®ÂíåÂ∞èËßÑÊ®°ÈÉ®ÁΩ≤„ÄÇ

Ubuntu Pro¬†ËÆ¢ÈòÖÔºà‰ª•ÂâçÁß∞‰∏∫ ‚ÄúUbuntu Advantage‚ÄùÔºâÊúÄÂàùÊòØ‰∏∫‰ºÅ‰∏öÊèê‰æõÁöÑÔºåÁî®‰∫é‰∏∫‰ªñ‰ª¨È¢ùÂ§ñÊèê‰æõ 5 Âπ¥ÁöÑ Ubuntu LTS ÁâàÊú¨ÁöÑÊâ©Â±ïÂÆâÂÖ®Áª¥Êä§Êõ¥Êñ∞„ÄÇ

ËØ•ÂÖçË¥πËÆ°‰ª∑Â±ÇÂ∑≤Âú®ÂÖ¨ÂÖ±ÊµãËØïÁâà‰∏≠Êèê‰æõ„ÄÇ

ÂØπ‰∫é‰∏™‰∫∫‰∏éÊï∞ÊçÆ‰∏≠ÂøÉÁöÑ Ubuntu Pro




ÁõÆÂâç‰Ωú‰∏∫ÊµãËØïÁâàÊèê‰æõÔºåUbuntu Pro ÁöÑÂÖçË¥πËÆ°‰ª∑Â±ÇÂèØ‰æõ‰∏™‰∫∫Áî®Êà∑ÊàñÂ∞èÂûãÊï∞ÊçÆ‰∏≠ÂøÉ‰ΩøÁî®ÔºåÊúÄÂ§öÂèØÂÆπÁ∫≥‰∫îÂè∞Êú∫Âô®„ÄÇ

ÈöèÁùÄÊ≠§Ê¨°ÂèëÂ∏ÉÔºåCanonical È¶ñÂ∏≠ÊâßË°åÂÆò Mark Shuttleworth Ë°®Á§∫Ôºö


Ëá™‰ªéÊàë‰ª¨È¶ñÊ¨°Êé®Âá∫ Ubuntu LTS ‰ª•Êù•ÔºåÂπ∂‰∏∫Ëøô‰∏™‰∏ªË¶ÅÁöÑÊìç‰ΩúÁ≥ªÁªüÂÖçË¥πÊèê‰æõ‰∫îÂπ¥ÁöÑÂÆâÂÖ®‰øùÈöúÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÁöÑ‰ºÅ‰∏öÂÆ¢Êà∑Ë¶ÅÊ±ÇÊàë‰ª¨Âú®ÁßÅ‰∫∫ÂïÜ‰∏öÂçèËÆÆ‰∏ãË¶ÜÁõñË∂äÊù•Ë∂äÂπøÊ≥õÁöÑÂºÄÊ∫êÈ¢ÜÂüü„ÄÇ‰ªäÂ§©ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÂæàÈ´òÂÖ¥ÈÄöËøáÂÖçË¥πÁöÑ‰∏™‰∫∫ Ubuntu Pro ËÆ¢ÈòÖÂÖçË¥πÂêë‰∏ñÁïå‰∏äÁöÑ‰ªª‰Ωï‰∫∫Êèê‰æõÔºÅ


‰∏éÊ†áÂáÜÂèëË°åÁâàÁõ∏ÊØîÔºåUbuntu Pro ÁöÑ‰∏ªË¶Å‰ºòÂäøÂú®‰∫é‰∏çÊñ≠Êèê‰æõÂÆâÂÖ®Ë°•‰∏Å„ÄÇ



ÂØπ‰∫éÂ∏åÊúõÁ≥ªÁªüÁ®≥ÂÆöËÄåÂèà‰∏ç‰ºö‰∏¢Â§±ÂÆâÂÖ®Êõ¥Êñ∞ÁöÑÁî®Êà∑Êù•ËØ¥ÔºåËøôÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Èöæ‰ª•ÁΩÆ‰ø°ÁöÑÂ•ΩÊ∂àÊÅØ„ÄÇ

ÂÆâÂÖ®Áª¥Êä§Êõ¥Êñ∞‰ºöÂÆöÊúüÊé®Âá∫ÔºåÂ∞§ÂÖ∂ÊòØÂú®ÂèëÁé∞Êñ∞ÁöÑ CVEÔºàÂ∏∏ËßÅÊºèÊ¥ûÂíåÊö¥Èú≤ÔºâÊó∂„ÄÇ

Áî®Êà∑ÂèØ‰ª•Âà©Áî®¬†Livepatch¬†Êù•Â∫îÁî®ÂÆâÂÖ®Ë°•‰∏ÅÔºåËÄåÊó†ÈúÄÂÖ≥Èó≠‰ªñ‰ª¨ÁöÑÁ≥ªÁªü„ÄÇËøôÂåÖÂê´Âú® Ubuntu Pro ËÆ¢ÈòÖ‰∏≠„ÄÇ

Â∞èÂûã‰ºÅ‰∏öÂíå‰∏™‰∫∫ËøòÂèØ‰ª•‰ΩøÁî®ÂêàËßÑÁÆ°ÁêÜÊâÄÈúÄÁöÑÂêÑÁßçÂ∑•ÂÖ∑ÔºåÊîØÊåÅ PCI-DSS„ÄÅHIPAA„ÄÅFedRAMP Á≠âÂêàËßÑÊ†áÂáÜÔºåÂπ∂‰Ωú‰∏∫ Ubuntu Pro ËÆ¢ÈòÖÁöÑ‰∏ÄÈÉ®ÂàÜ„ÄÇ

articles.author: Chris Hermansen
articles.description:
Groovy vs Java: Connecting a PostgreSQL database with JDBC
Chris Hermansen
Tue, 10/11/2022 - 03:00

            
Lately, I've been looking at how Groovy streamlines the slight clunkiness of Java. This article examines some differences between connecting to a PostgreSQL database using JDBC in Java versus Groovy.
Install Java and Groovy
Groovy is based on Java and requires a Java installation. Both a recent/decent version of Java and Groovy might be in your Linux distribution's repositories, or you can install Groovy by following these instructions. A nice alternative for Linux users is SDKMan, which provides multiple versions of Java, Groovy, and many other related tools. For this article, I'm using SDK's releases of:
Java version 11.0.12-open of OpenJDK 11
Groovy version 3.0.8
Back to the ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Groovy vs Java: Connecting a PostgreSQL database with JDBC

articles.author: Stefano Maffulli
articles.description:
Defining an open source AI for the greater good
Stefano Maffulli
Mon, 10/10/2022 - 03:00

            
Artificial intelligence (AI) has become more prevalent in our daily lives. While AI systems may intend to offer users convenience, there have been numerous examples of automated tools getting it wrong, resulting in serious consequences. What's happening in the AI system that leads to erroneous and harmful conclusions? Probably a dramatic combo of bad AI combined with a lack of human oversight. How do we as a society prevent AI ethics fails?
The open source community has had, for well over 20 years, clear processes for dealing with errors ("bugs") in software. The Open Source Definition firmly establishes the rights of developers and the rights of users. There are frameworks, licenses, and‚Ä¶
articles.title: Defining an open source AI for the greater good

articles.author: Seth Kenlon
articles.description:
Learn programming at Open Jam 2022
Seth Kenlon
Fri, 10/07/2022 - 03:00

            
Open Jam game jam is happening from October 28 to November 9 this year. Every year for the past several years, programmers from around the globe build open source video games, and then play and rate one another's games. Just for fun.
Open Jam is a "game jam," which is a casual way to inspire programmers of all skill levels to focus on a just-for-fun project for a concentrated period of time. It promotes open source games as well as open source game creation tools. While participants aren't required to use open source tools to create their game, the games themselves must bear an open license, and you literally get extra points during the scoring round for using open source tools.
Another important aspect of‚Ä¶
articles.title: Learn programming at Open Jam 2022

articles.author: Savita Ashture
articles.description:
Dynamically update TLS certificates in a Golang server without downtime
Savita Ashture
Thu, 10/06/2022 - 03:00

            
Transport Layer Security (TLS) is a cryptographic protocol based on SSLv3 designed to encrypt and decrypt traffic between two sites. In other words, TLS ensures that you're visiting the site you meant to visit and prevents anyone between you and the website from seeing the data being passed back and forth. This is achieved through the mutual exchange of digital certificates: a private one that exists on the web server, and a public one typically distributed with web browsers.
In production environments, all servers run securely, but server certificates may expire after some period. It is then the server's responsibility to validate, regenerate, and reuse newly genera‚Ä¶
articles.title: Dynamically update TLS certificates in a Golang server without downtime

articles.author: Aditya R
articles.description:
Use OCI containers to run WebAssembly workloads
Aditya R
Wed, 10/05/2022 - 03:00

            
WebAssembly (also referred to as Wasm) has gained popularity as a portable binary instruction format with an embeddable and isolated execution environment for client and server applications. Think of WebAssembly as a small, fast, efficient, and very secure stack-based virtual machine designed to execute portable bytecode that doesn't care what CPU or operating system it runs on. WebAssembly was initially designed for web browsers to be a lightweight, fast, safe, and polyglot container for functions, but it's no longer limited to the web.
On the web, WebAssembly uses the existing APIs provided by browsers. WebAssembly System Interface (WASI) was created to fill the void between WebAssembly and sys‚Ä¶
articles.title: Use OCI containers to run WebAssembly workloads

articles.author: Anamika
articles.description:
Learn the OSI model in 5 minutes
Anamika
Tue, 10/04/2022 - 03:00

            
The Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model is a standard for how computers, servers, and people communicate within a system. It was the first standard model for network communications and was adopted in the early 1980s by all major computer and telecommunications companies.
The OSI model provides a universal language for describing networks and thinking about them in discrete chunks, or layers.
Layers of the OSI model
The model describes the seven layers through which computer systems communicate over a network.
Application layer
Presentation layer
Session layer
Transport layer
Network layer
Data link layer
Physical layer
Each of these layers has its own way of working, with its own set of protocols that disti‚Ä¶
articles.title: Learn the OSI model in 5 minutes

articles.author: Yacine Si Tayeb, PhD
articles.description:
5 new improvements in Apache ShardingSphere
Yacine Si Tayeb, PhD
Tue, 10/04/2022 - 03:00

            
Apache ShardingSphere, a powerful distributed database, recently released a major update to optimize and enhance its features, performance, testing, documentation, and examples. In short, the project continues to work hard at development to make it easier for you to manage your organization's data.
1. SQL audit for data sharding
The problem: When a user executes an SQL query without the sharding feature in large-scale data sharding scenarios, the SQL query is routed to the underlying database for execution. As a result, many database connections are occupied, and businesses are severely affected by a timeout or other issues. Worse still, should the user perform an UPDATE/DELETE operation,‚Ä¶
articles.title: 5 new improvements in Apache ShardingSphere

articles.author: Phil Shapiro
articles.description:
Is your old computer 'obsolete', or is it a Linux opportunity?
Phil Shapiro
Mon, 10/03/2022 - 03:00

            
You may often hear someone claim a computer, tablet, or smartphone is "obsolete." When you hear such a statement, take a minute to ask yourself, "Is this person speaking an opinion or a fact?"
Many times, their statement is an opinion. Let me explain why.
When someone declares a computer "obsolete," they often speak from their own point of view. So, if you're a technology professional, a five-year-old computer might indeed be obsolete. But is that same five-year-old computer obsolete to a refugee family fleeing war or famine? Probably not. A computer that is obsolete for you might be a dream computer for someone else.
How I refurbish old computers with Linux
I have some experie‚Ä¶
articles.title: Is your old computer 'obsolete', or is it a Linux opportunity?

articles.author: Jim Hall
articles.description:
What's new with Awk?
Jim Hall
Sat, 10/01/2022 - 03:00

            
Awk is a powerful scripting tool that makes it easy to process text. Awk scripts use a pattern-action syntax, where Awk performs an action for every line in a file that matches a pattern. This provides a flexible yet powerful scripting language to deal with text. For example, the one-line Awk script /error/ {print $1, $2, $3} will print the first three space-delimited fields for any line that contains the word error.
While we also have the GNU variant of Awk, called Gawk, the original Awk remains under development. Recently, Brian Kernighan started a project to add Unicode support to Awk. I met with Brian to ask about the origins of Awk and his recent development work on Awk.
Jim Hall: Awk is a great tool to parse and proc‚Ä¶
articles.title: What's new with Awk?

articles.author: Don Watkins
articles.description:
How I dock my Linux laptop
Don Watkins
Fri, 09/30/2022 - 03:00

            
Not that long ago, docking a laptop was a new idea to me. Since then, I've set up two different laptops for docking, and I've been more than satisfied with how this configuration works. This article describes how I set up the laptop docking stations and gives tips and guidance for anyone considering the same.
How I discovered docking
I began 2020 with one laptop: a Darter Pro purchased from System76 the year before. It had been more than adequate, and I enjoyed the freedom of movement that toting a laptop gave me. Then, of course, everything changed.
Suddenly, I was at home all the time. Instead of an occasional video conference, remote meetings and get-togethers became the norm. I grew tired of the little square ‚Ä¶
articles.title: How I dock my Linux laptop

articles.description:
The next-gen NUC Extreme PC (seen left) will still be compact, despite being significantly larger than its predecessors. | Image: Intel
    

  
Intel has teased its upcoming NUC 13 Extreme PC, the latest addition to the NUC (Next Unit of Computing) family of small-form-factor computers and barebone computer kits. The PC codenamed Raptor Canyon was revealed at TwitchCon this past weekend, as reported by VideoCardz, and notably sports a significantly bigger design than its predecessor to support larger graphics cards.
A teardown of the upcoming PC was carried out on the convention floor, giving us an indication of its larger size compared to previous models within Intel‚Äôs NUC range. It confirmed that Raptor Canyon can support up to a full desktop Core i9 processor and up to 64GB of DDR5 memory. 2.5 and 3-slot graphics cards are also supported, with an unnamed Nvidia GeForce RTX 30...
Continue reading‚Ä¶
articles.title: Intel NUCs are sizing up to accommodate bigger upgrades

articles.description:
Delta Airlines will invest $60 million in Joby Aviation, a leading electric air taxi startup, to create a ‚Äúhome-to-airport‚Äù service using the startup‚Äôs five-seat electric vertical takeoff and landing (eVTOL) aircraft, the companies announced Tuesday. Delta said its investment in Joby could go as high as $200 million if the company hits certain milestones. 
The service, which will launch first in New York City and Los Angeles with other cities to follow, will be ‚Äúmutually exclusive‚Äù across the US and UK for five years, with the option to extend that exclusivity for longer, the companies said. The home-to-airport service will exist in parallel to Joby‚Äôs currently nonexistent airport service, transporting passengers from cities to airports.
Continue reading‚Ä¶
articles.title: Delta Airlines will invest up to $200 million in Joby Aviation to create a ‚Äòhome-to-airport‚Äô air taxi service

articles.description:
GM Energy will sell EV chargers, external batteries, and other accessories for its electric vehicle owners.  | GM
    


  		 
GM Energy is making a grab for a piece of the $150 billion energy generation and storage market. The automaker wants to shore up the grid in preparation for a tidal wave of new EVs. 
Continue reading‚Ä¶
articles.title: GM created a new energy business to sell batteries and solar panels in bid to dethrone Tesla

A pile of unannounced Roku-branded light strips spotted by a Redditor. | Image: u/Negative_Source_7316 / Reddit
    

  
Roku is about to make a big entrance into the smart home if a photo posted to Reddit and two shipping manifests spotted by ZatzNotFunny are to be believed. 
The unannounced lineup reportedly consists of both white and color smart bulbs, a smart light strip, a smart plug, and indoor and outdoor internet-connected security cameras. Roku also appears to be planning to launch a dedicated Roku Smart Home channel, which will presumably let users control the devices from smart TVs and streaming boxes running the company‚Äôs operating system.
Not sure if anyone really cares, found some unannounced stuff the other day. from
      Roku
    
As ZatzNotFunny and several Reddit commenters have pointed out, Roku appears to be leaning...

articles.title: Roku could be setting its sights on the smart home

articles.description:
Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge
    

  
On Monday afternoon, as pointed out by Parker Molloy, CNN ended its big Web3 project by announcing, ‚Äúwe have decided that it‚Äôs time to say goodbye to the Vault by CNN.‚Äù 
You may have already forgotten about it, but Vault by CNN launched in the summer of 2021 as a marketplace for its own NFTs (non-fungible tokens) that would ‚Äúoffer collectors the opportunity to own a piece of history.‚Äù Sort of like NBA Top Shot except for media nerds instead of basketball nerds, it minted CNN reports of key events or artistic interpretations inspired by them, creating digital collectibles that owners could show off somehow or trade with others, like baseball cards. This idea apparently seemed more reasonable while cryptocurrency prices were sky-high, and...

articles.title: CNN accused of rug pull as it abandons its NFT project

articles.description:
Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge
    

  
Amazon Prime Day is no longer a once-per-year shopping event. This year, the company is hosting a second deal extravaganza for Prime members called the Prime Early Access Sale, which kicks off tomorrow, October 11th, and runs through Wednesday, October 12th. If it‚Äôs anything like the two-day shopping blitz that is Prime Day, it‚Äôll be filled with some of the lowest prices we‚Äôve seen on 4K TVs, Amazon Echo devices, noise-canceling headphones, gaming accessories, laptops, and more. We also expect to see competing deals at retailers like Target, Best Buy, and Walmart, all of which we‚Äôll cover during the 48-hour window.
Like we‚Äôve done in the past with Prime Day, we‚Äôll be rounding up all of the details regarding Amazon‚Äôs fall sales event...
Continue reading‚Ä¶
articles.title: The Verge Guide to Amazon‚Äôs Prime Early Access Sale

Laura Normand / The Verge
    

  
In an interview with the Financial Times last week, Elon Musk revealed that figures in the Chinese government have asked him directly to withhold Starlink access within China. Musk told FT that, in the publication‚Äôs summary, ‚ÄúBeijing has made clear its disapproval of his recent rollout of Starlink...in Ukraine‚Äù and ‚Äúsought assurances he would not sell Starlink in China.‚Äù
It‚Äôs unclear from the description whether Musk agreed to Beijing‚Äôs request, but Starlink‚Äôs service map shows no plans to deploy in China. Adjacent countries like Taiwan, Mongolia and Vietnam are listed as ‚Äúpending regulatory approval.‚Äù
Starlink‚Äôs service map shows no plans to deploy in China
Offering a connection to the internet that sidesteps conventional service...

articles.title: China asked Elon Musk not to sell Starlink within the country

Existing tools are built for professionals and are overpowered with features that most of us don‚Äôt need. Most podcasters and small businesses don‚Äôt have the time or resources to learn how to edit waveforms, navigate complex timelines, and create content with them. Hipclip is here to change that.

How Hipclip can help:

1. Automatically convert your podcasts and webinars into interactive transcripts visualized like a word document.

2. Edit words, not waveforms. Quickly eliminate filler words, pauses & silences, and off-topic bits you don‚Äôt need. Our AI identifies these for you.

3. Repurpose long-form content into bite-sized clips to promote your episodes and win on social media. (Graphic design templates coming soon)

4. Turn your transcripts into blog posts or e-books. Make the most of your content by getting that free search traffic! (AI copywriter coming soon)

All of this works inside your browser; no need to download or install anything.

We are just getting started and super excited for what‚Äôs coming next:

- Grammarly-like assistant to further automate your work

- Seamless multi-track editing that won‚Äôt make your head spin

- 1-click sound enhancement and de-noise

And so much more!

We made a special discount for the PH community ‚Äì give us a try with a code ‚ÄúHELLOPH‚Äù

Our team will be here all day, so feel free to drop us a comment :)

At Visla, we are on a mission to revolutionize video creation and communication. We believe that businesses of all sizes should have access to affordable and easy-to-use video creation tools. Our goal is to empower businesses to tell their stories and connect with their audiences through video.

üî• Our best features:
- Video recording with dynamic layout change and a teleprompter
- Connect your mobile to desktop to be used as a second camera
- Transcription-based Editing ‚Äì it‚Äôs never been easier to edit a video
- Quick Editing features for quickly Cutting, Extracting, adding Call-To-Action, or just a quick Voice-Over
- AI powered auto-cut to remove unwanted parts such as filler words and pauses
- AI recommendations for supplemental footage to add that extra layer of pizzaz to your project
- Easily share your videos and get feedback from your team 

üìà How can you use it?
- Create Marketing and Product Demo videos while showcasing your company branding
- Build lead generation and boost your engagement rate with personalized video messages
- Collect feedback and testimonials from clients for your business
- Send internal memos to collaborate and build rapport with your colleagues
- Repurpose recordings and share highlight snippets to your team

I know some of you already understand our solution and may still be curious about why you should use Visla. It‚Äôs not just our years of experience working with users, but also our years of experience listening to users that has helped us build Visla. My team and I will be here all day listening to your questions and comments, and we look forward to them!

We were facilitating a few dozen interviews per month, and we were exhausted. Collecting feedback, maintaining the quality of interviews we were not present for, and making decisions with minimal data points. We knew we could do better, and less than a week after that Reddit post, we started building. We received backing from a VC firm with only a team and a dream just two months later. After being waitlist-only for seven months as we built out our initial offering, we're ready to fix hiring processes for the masses, and we're celebrating by launching on Product Hunt.

articles.description:
https://github.com/verfasor/Insecta

üëá Example queries

White space between the words are fine, mmkay.

üîê General query 	
GET https://bugs.verfasor.com/api?q=Soldier%20Beetle.

üîê Query a Common Name 	
GET https://bugs.verfasor.com/api?q=Soldier%20Beetle

üîê Query a Genus 	
GET https://bugs.verfasor.com/api?Genus=Chauliognathus

üîê Query Species 	
GET https://bugs.verfasor.com/api?Species=pensylvanicus

üîê Query a Family 	
GET https://bugs.verfasor.com/api?Family=Cantharidae

üîê Query an Order 	
GET https://bugs.verfasor.com/api?Order=Coleoptera.

üîê Query a Bug Guide ID 	
GET https://bugs.verfasor.com/api?BugGuideID=438

üîê Query combination and filter 	
GET https://bugs.verfasor.com/api?Order=Coleoptera&q=beetle

üêç Python script

I've created an example Python script to fetch random data at once.
Available at: https://github.com/verfasor/Insecta/blob/master/random-bug.py

üêú Disclaimer

The Insects JSON REST API is actually in the alpha stage, which implies that "bugs" and issues may still remain undiscovered until this phase of testing is complete. The alpha stage also means that the data may be corrupted, is not 100% validated or complete, and is subject to change. Finally, services may have downtime and the API schemas and calls are subject to change
